website_summaries.verdict: Simple but popular heart rate monitor that also calculates fitness zones.
pros: Well-liked for its functionality and affordability
Accurate heart rate reading continually displayed
Calculates calories burned and fat-burning zone
Can be used as normal watch when not in exercise mode (displays time, day, date)
Comfortable chest strap stays in place and is washable

customer_reviews.title: Am pretty sure this is very inaccurate when it comes to ...
customer_reviews.text: Am pretty sure this is very inaccurate when it comes to calculating the calories you burn and all that. It was easy to change the settings on this however, my biggest problem is that, this is more of a distraction to me than it is helpful. It gives me an error message about 5times during my workouts about my HR signals. It just pointless, I have to keep checking it to ensure that its working which takes time off my workout time in the morning. I had higher expectations purchasing this but I must say am disappointed. The only thing is that, am now using it more as a wrist watch than a HR monitior
customer_reviews.author: Aba Eshun

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This heart rate monitor just does not last long. I've brought 3 of these watches in the past because of the price and the simplicity. The problem I would have is the signal from the strap to the watch would not communicate. My watch would show 00. I would readjust the strap, put water on the strap, tighten the strap it would work then later 00 would show on the watch this would go on throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: Fitness Guru

customer_reviews.title: HRM has a poor signal output
customer_reviews.text: I have had a number of Polar HRM in my life. All have been very adequate. This one, however, has a very poor signal to the wrist monitor and loses it signal constantly. Shows 00 and "check signal" a majority of the time. When it does pick up a signal it is accurate but the way it is now it useless and unreliable. I have tried electrobe gel which helps some but still frequently loses it signal. I have changed the battery in the belt and the monitor several times to no avail. I emailed Polar and it's now been 3 days and no reply. I am really disappointed. $76 item, not that expensive, but should work.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H Goodman

customer_reviews.title: To get any reading I had to fit it a lot more than "snug" - I had to basically pull it super tight and almost cut off circulatio
customer_reviews.text: After playing with it for one day and not getting any HR below 188 when I was not active, I decided to return it. I tried all of the (very weak) suggestions from Polar support but to no avail. The problem is not with placement, or interference, or lack of moisture. To get any reading I had to fit it a lot more than "snug" - I had to basically pull it super tight and almost cut off circulation. The problem appears to be it's a junky product that just doesn't function as advertised. I'm not sure how some others had such great experiences. I'd stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Orange Crush

customer_reviews.title: Nice Basic Model
customer_reviews.text: This is my first HRM. I'm very happy with it. I use it to track all my work outs whether its walking, yoga, tai chi, qi gong, kickboxing, body building or biking. Then I upload it to the Polar website. It keeps me motivated to see how much (or little) I work out week to week. It tracks calories burned too so you can see if you have to work harder to burn more calories. This is a pretty basic model but it's all I really need. I use a program on my phone to track distance for my walks and rides since I keep my phone on me anyway.
customer_reviews.author: WorldGypsyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Dead batteries on arrival.  Buy CR1632s and CR2025s if you want to use this out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for a simple, no-frills, watch-and-band monitor for myself and another person. One worked out of the box, but the other required a change of battery of both the watch unit (CR1632) and the chest strap (CR2025). These thankfully are user-changeable and don't require you to send it off to a service center. After a change of battery, the unit worked OK. Just keep in mind that this bumps up the true initial cost of the FT7 to $100+, depending on how cheaply you can buy these batteries. Will update review in a few months to comment on longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING
customer_reviews.text: WAS OK WHEN IT WORKED. STOPPED WORKING AFTER 1 YEAR. CHANGED BATTERIES AND STILL DID NOT WORK. WISH TIMEX MADE A HEART RATE MONITOR. POLAR OVER PRICED AND JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: RayGUN

customer_reviews.title: This polar watch does absolutely everything that I would like for it to
customer_reviews.text: This polar watch does absolutely everything that I would like for it to. I mainly got it to count calories. I do have to admit that I am thinking about upgrading as I have had it for some time. It tells you your target heart rates based on the information that you enter to it. Your weight, height, age, etc. I would have to say that it is much more accurate for calorie burning then relying on the treadmill. I'm so glad I finally bought this. Doesn't have all the bells and whistles and some of the other models but definitely does a great job giving me a history of my workouts. Love the polar watch.
customer_reviews.author: Valentina

customer_reviews.title: Tracking your workout and graphing your results is a great way to motivate anyone
customer_reviews.text: Get the DATA-LINK and you are all set to track your progress after each workout. This is a basic watch that monitors heart rate if you use a heart sensor. I download my data from each workout instantly by using the Polar Flowlink. This watch will measure your heart rate throughout your workout and based on your age will determine the number of minutes that your rate was in the fitness level (% - age of maximum heart rate). Tracking your workout and graphing your results is a great way to motivate anyone. I am very pleased with my weight loss and improved fitness. If you want a basic monitoring device, this model is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Sidlak

customer_reviews.title: Comes in handy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this years ago, without reading it was for men. Regardless, I liked it until the strap broke. I haven't used it since but think it's a good product that comes in handy if you are looking for a monitor. My father used this decades ago when he was racing mountain and road bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Lakin

customer_reviews.title: Have to send the FT7 sent to me because it ...
customer_reviews.text: Had to send my used FT7 back because it doesn't "set up". I read the "get started " directions but nothing happened when I hold "any button" for a second. It does not ask for imput. Right out of the box! Very dissapointed after reading the positive reviews. Update 3/22 I recieved a brand new FT7 today and it "set up" just like the first one was supposed to. This one works fine. The first one was used. My guess is someone "set it up" and then returned it therefore it woudn't work for me. Very satisfied, easy to operate and is all I need.
customer_reviews.author: BikeMike

customer_reviews.title: Worked ok for a while, then quit after about a year
customer_reviews.text: The makers of this product got a few things right, but in the end, it lasted a little over a year for me. Paying close to $70 for a product like this for me means that I will keep it for a while, and now I'm pretty disappointed with it. I like its overall simplicity and design. But it went through batteries quickly - much quicker than my previous system, and then it just stopped working. I replace both batteries, and the sensor kept sending out seemingly random data.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Useful, but not great
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Chest strap and watch computer feel durable - Removal of the transmitter from the chest strap for easy cleaning and preserving the battery - A variety of displays (heart rate, effect, duration, etc) Cons: - It can be a hassle getting the unit to receive the signal from the chest strap - you need to verify signal is received before starting your workout. Once it finds it, it tends to not lose it. - Occasional incorrect readings, which are often twice or half your actual heart rate - You can not display the duration and heart rate at the same time - this would be nice for interval training
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mathason

customer_reviews.title: It Works At First
customer_reviews.text: If I'd rated this a couple of months ago when I bought this I would have given it 5 stars. After just two months of solid use the chest strap device has stopped working or communicating consistently with the watch or other gym equipment. The connection is intermittent and I have to push and hold the chest device up against my chest while exercising just to get a good reading. UPDATE: After 7 months, despite adding electro gel, eventually the thing just stopped working. Replacing the battery does nothing. I decided to wait on the Apple iWatch. What a waste of 70 bucks. I hate these chest strap monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Sephethus

customer_reviews.title: Nice but Distinct Limitation
customer_reviews.text: If you are wanting to keep track of your workouts and VO2max, this is not the watch for you. I probably didn't do enough research before I bought this watch. As I had been used to the Polar brand and my review suggested they all did their proprietary VO2max estimate. However, the fine print on the website suggests this is the one version that does not. Looks sleek and works otherwise well but would recommend spending just a little bit more the the full deal. This will make a great re-gift for someone not as interested as I about their fitness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for seven months now. The heart rate monitor worked the first time I used it and ever since. I haven't replaced the batteries yet. The nice thing about this watch is that all the batteries are self replaceable. I wear the watch daily and haven't had any problems. The included instructions are not detailed enough so you may want to download the PDF manual from their website. Overall, I am we'll pleased with this watch and it's heart rate monitoring functions. April 30, 2013: This watch is still going strong. I still haven't replaced any batteries. The watch band has held up well. There are no signs of band wear.
customer_reviews.author: Sendai Georgia

customer_reviews.title: OK for running, Unreliable for cycling
customer_reviews.text: I have had this HRM for about 2 weeks. While it is reliable 99% of the time when running, it is highly unreliable when cycling. About 5-10% of any ride, readings of 227, 210, 205 are quite the norm. Other times it will jump from 127 to 158 in the matter of 1-2 seconds. If you are using this for running/walking/gym workouts it is most likely a decent option. If you are looking for a HRM for cycling workouts, I would not recommend this one. It has been nearly impossible for me to conduct my Zone Training with any accuracy. I am just really pleased that Amazon has such a great return policy and stands by it's products.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Shapouri

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice HRM. It calculates my calories burned fairly accurately and measures my heart rate accurately (I checked it manually every once in a while to determine the accuracy). It also serves as a good watch when not using it strictly for measuring my heart rate. However, I was originally sent a transmitter that didn't work even with a new battery. I sent an email to the company and didn't get a response for a week or so. Called in and got a new transmitter free of charge within about 7 days. Overall great product but disappointed that I was sent a broken transmitter.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Riley

customer_reviews.title: Works, but...
customer_reviews.text: I have had quite a bit of trouble with it. First, I found the instructions which came with it unintelligible; I had to call the company to learn how to use it, which is pretty simple, given intelligible instructions. The wrist unit and transmitter have worked well, but I have had to replace the chest strap twice. It seems that the snap contacts on the strap are prone to corrode and not connect. Trouble is, when the system doesn't work, it is not obvious which component is at fault. Mine went back to the factory to get it figured out.
customer_reviews.author: brookej

customer_reviews.title: Polar FT7 - Not for swimming.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this particularly for swimming. Thought it would be nice to track my heart rate. But found it useless once I tried it in a pool. The sensor that you have to attach to your body constantly slips off your chest every time you make turns or swim with a decent speed. Tried to make it super tight, but still had the same problem. The best use of this tracker would be jog, walk, just regular daily activities. But if you consider this Polar tracker for swimming, this may be not the best option.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandr P

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work. Won't turn on. Thanks for wasting my time.
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to get this because I had heard good things about it, but the watch won't turn on. Stupid thing #1 about this product: the "getting started guide" explains everything but how to turn the watch on, the most important instruction. Stupid thing #2, when I go to the website and download the manual, it says "press and hold any button for one second" to turn it on, but those instructions don't work. I've tried that several times and the watch does not turn on. Stupid thing #3: let's call for support. Oh, sorry, we are only open monday through friday. Thanks for sending me a defective product and for wasting my time.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D. Long

customer_reviews.title: Looking for consistency
customer_reviews.text: As I get older I wanted a device that would help me in exercising. Biking, running, bootcamp, lifting weights, etc, the HRM helps me keep track of my activity level. Going to various internet sources for calories expended is all over the place. With the Polar FT7, I have a consistent device that will help me keep track of my activity level and the amount of calories expended in various exercises. So far, I have learned that the HRM calories expended is far less than what the internet sites say you are expending. To me that is just fine. Less is better than too much.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Aufdenkampe

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly unreliable with very short lifespan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help during my workouts but all it does is frustrate and distract me. So incredibly disappointing and frustrating. This worked for a few months but now without fail every single workout loses signal and shows hear rate "00", or says "check heart rate signal". I have diligently followed all care and maintanence instructions, replaced batteries, purchased a new strap, searched online and on on YouTube hours and hours looking for solutions, nothing works, this is just simply a bad product. I'm beyond done trying to get this HR monitor to work and will be buying a new HR monitor that is definitely NOT a polar brand!!!
customer_reviews.author: TODD

customer_reviews.title: The monitor works fine as a monitor
customer_reviews.text: The monitor works fine as a monitor. What I give this product low marks for is its ability to share results across different platforms -- garmin, mapmyride, strava, etc. The instructions are impossible to make any sense of, and you are frequently redirected to a site that is written in Finnish. I am not an amateur at using data devices, but Polar is even worse sharing than Garmin (which is pretty bad). So, if you just want to keep your pulse, great. If you want to use it for anything sophisticated, you will spend a bunch of time talking to support.
customer_reviews.author: TexasCyclistg

customer_reviews.title: Decent Monitor, But Not Great
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Polar heart rate monitor, and this one is an upgrade to the previous style I had. Overall, it's a good monitor. There seems to be a consistent problem with the chest strap (on both my current and previous models). Too often, the signal between the wrist component and the chest strap is lost and sometimes can't be brought back with some adjusting of the strap. It doesn't happen all the time, but when it does, it's a huge drain on my motivation, as I like to track all of my workouts from start to finish. That said, for the most part, it doesn't happen terribly often, so this is a pretty good monitor for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Rob in Denver

customer_reviews.title: The fix was to cut a short fine gauge strand from a copper multi strand wire
customer_reviews.text: Eventually OK. My FT7 exhibited erratic 220 /0 readings. New batteries in Rcvr & Trans did not help. An A/B comparison with a non-Polar Rcvr also gave the 220/0 readings. Problem> Trans: Erratic readings> intermittent electrical connections. The problem is the snap connections for pickup strap to Trans module. The fix was to cut a short fine gauge strand from a copper multi strand wire, form it into the shape of a "U", and place one into each of the snap connector receptacles. The copper shims stabilized the electrical connections. No more 220/0 readings.
customer_reviews.author: Still learning

customer_reviews.title: Got here really fast, and it works great!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. For once I get an accurate reading of how many calories I am burning, and it helps me push myself to work harder. Very easy to navigate, the instructions are only 5 pages long in each language, and it's very straightforward. I am overweight and the chest strap fit me just fine (that's the only thing I was worrying about after buying this). Definitely would recommend this! EDIT: It's been a few weeks since I started using this, and it's still doing amazing. It's really improved the effectiveness of my workouts, because now I can cater my eating habits to how much I'm actually burning. Most definitely a really, really good HR monitor/calories burned counter.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Lauren Lovett

customer_reviews.title: Good item for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this works great and syncs up well. The only beef I have is that sometimes it is hard to get it to make the initial connection. It says to get the leads wet. Sometimes I have to do that multiple times and "soak" myself a little before it starts transmitting. Once or twice it has established a connection and then blipped out and I had to rewet the leads. For the price though it is pretty good and effective and suits my need, even with the occasional inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Daylon L. Welliver

customer_reviews.title: but gives her a general idea of where she is at fitness-wise for the day and she has been a happy camper with the Fit Bit
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my wife, an after about 9 months of heavy daily use it crapped out on her. Granted she is a heavy sweater, but I expected a Heart Rate monitor designed for use during athletic activities would last longer. We tried going through the manufatures warranty program, but t was too much of a hassle. She ultimately ended up with a Fit Bit...it doesn't provide as much detailed information, but gives her a general idea of where she is at fitness-wise for the day and she has been a happy camper with the Fit Bit.
customer_reviews.author: W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Dependable for 18 months!
customer_reviews.text: Works like it's supposed to and is easy to set and to stop long enough for a rest and continue again. Doesn't seem to give credit for as many calories burned as other HRM's but at least it's consistent. Just put my 2nd battery in the watch and i've had three or four in the chest strap. Great for a year and a half. Walking and biking!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Blair

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch! Tells me I w many calories I burned, my heart rate and how long I was in the fat burning zone or improving fitness. The heart rate monitor works perfectly and the watch isn't too big that it looks bulky. Simply perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Elisa

customer_reviews.title: Wanted a heart rate monitor where I didn't have to wear a strap around my chest . . .
customer_reviews.text: how is that comfortable when you are training?? Didn't realize "The FT7 comes complete with comfortable fabric transmitter and coded heart rate transmission" at the very bottom of the page meant strap. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Great Kids

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a week
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a week. Broke. Sent off for repair. Polar sent it back, repaired for free. Worked again for a couple of months. Broke. Constantly loses connection with the chest strap or won't connect at all. Batteries changed multiple times to no avail. Frustrating beyond any benefit it ever gave me. Polar's customer service was quick and kind. I cannot speak for any other product in their line, but this specific one is a dud in my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Cox

customer_reviews.title: Simple and it works - chest strap is the "medium" size.
customer_reviews.text: Simple HR monitor that calculates calories burned. That is all I used it for (and to know where my HR is). I can't comment on the rest of options/settings. The chest strap that comes with it (for the men's black/silver) can be tight for bigger users. I take it as encouragement to lose inches of my chest :). Seriously, if 44 inches or more (I think) of chest size, you need the big strap, which amazon does not seem to sell with the watch. Other websites sell the watch with option of chest strap size for a comparable size.
customer_reviews.author: Pao

customer_reviews.title: perfection
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things! This is the most accurate monitor I have ever bought and I am extremely satisfied. I also forget that I even have it on a few hours after working out! I tuck it up underneath my sports bra and it doesn't budge while running and doing T25/P90X. Would HIGHLY recommend. Also, there were a few times I had forgotten to wet the underside of the monitor before working out and I still got an accurate reading so I haven't done this since.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Using this monitor help track my exercise calories. There is really a difference between what the bikes and other gym machines say is calories burned and this monitor. This is about 40% of what those machines say. I believe this rather than the "feel good" total on the machines. The chest strap fit my 350 lb body snug but comfortable. No problem picking up my heart rate. Some of the gym's machines also pickup the signal from Polar .
customer_reviews.author: E. Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Fitness tracker; well worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what I was getting into with a heart rate monitor/fitness watch. After some disastrous issues with the Nike Fuelband (I went through 4 of them and I take great care of my things!) I knew it was time to switch. I really like this. I get to see calories burned, how long it took, I can pause when I need to, and the strap, which was my biggest concern, isn't even noticeable once I start moving. I'm glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: He wanted a watch with a heart rate monitor which most of the slimmer devices out in the market like FitBit, Garmin (the more ba
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas gift for the hubby. He wanted a watch with a heart rate monitor which most of the slimmer devices out in the market like FitBit, Garmin (the more basic ones), etc. do not have. He was very happy. The price point is excellent. The piece is of course not as slim as the others mentioned but it does the job, for a fraction of the price -- substance over aesthetics -- this one is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: sugar stealer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I really bought this set for the heart monitor and strap. Works all the time with the sports equipment at my gym. The watch works great too, but I don't use it so often, There are better apps on my phone for tracking heart monitor than the watch does, but it's a nice backup and easy to use. Once in a while I need to wet the strap to enhance conductivity of the sensor. I tried a little dab of the electrode gel and it'is a guarantee of success, but I rarely need to use it. We'll see how long the strap holds up. Going for 3 months now.
customer_reviews.author: Magno

customer_reviews.title: Swimming use
customer_reviews.text: I have used polar monitors for 14 years. Because of a spinal cord injury I use the FT7 exclusively for swimming. The included transmitter does not work consistently in the water so I used an old T31coded transmitter and it works well and consistently for swimming. I had an FT4 and it works similar to the FT7. However with the FT7 I am able to download data from the FT7 to my computer using flow link. I highly recommend both the FT4 and the FT7 for swimming but only with the use of a T31 coded transmitter.
customer_reviews.author: PD

customer_reviews.title: Great HRM
customer_reviews.text: I've had a regular HRM from Polar for over a decade. When the strap finally broke, I decided to upgrade to something with more features. I love the FT7! It has great features and the chest strap is way more comfortable than the old-style plastic/nylon combo strap. The FT7 is very simple to set up and has lot of useful features. You put in your height/weight/sex and it tracks your calorie burn for every workout. It also keeps a history so you can scroll back in time and see how your latest effort measures up against your previous workouts. It has options for LARGE or small display so it is easy to read. I love it, you should buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Kris H

customer_reviews.title: It's like paying to send garbage through the mail
customer_reviews.text: The watch is completely blank after multiple tries to replace the battery and reset. Lasted 5 workouts. $7.50 shipping fee to have watch sent to NY and returned really turned me off! Especially when I feel they'll just send me a replacement. It's like paying to send garbage through the mail.
customer_reviews.author: RAYMOND J. SCHMOTZER

customer_reviews.title: Hard to read clock face
customer_reviews.text: The numbers are tiny on clock face, and the directions are a bit counterintuitive. The band across (at least my) chest seems a bit tight, so I do not think this will fit a man much above average girth. Kind of nice feature is the range you are provided between aerobic and anaerobic levels. Just not sure how this algorithm calculates these numbers. But at least it give me one more tiny motivator to exercise if I can focus on the watch instead of thinking about how much I hate a treadmill
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase of a Heart Rate Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase in a long time. Second Polar I've owned. Last one was purchased a few years ago and changing batteries was a pain. This one is fantastic. Love how it breaks down fat burning and fitness workouts. Fabric strap is much more comfortable then the old rubber one. Would highly recommend this Heart Rate Monitor.
customer_reviews.author: JonH

customer_reviews.title: Working fine,
customer_reviews.text: I read some reviews of problems with this product so I am prepared for that. Have not had any problems yet. My last Polar HRM had to be sent to repair shop to have batteries changed. This one I can do myself so that is a great improvement. I works well with the equipment at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: David Gulick

customer_reviews.title: Really great product
customer_reviews.text: It takes some getting use to, you have to "work" with it a bit. Once you do, though, you'll come to appreciate it's features. It's sturdy and I like the fact the "monitor" comes off the strap so you can wash it. It also stops the "transmission" so you aren't wearing the battery out. The watch itself is smaller, but it is something you get use to. The only complaint that I have is that it doesn't track distance. I realize that I would have had to buy a different model. Frankly, that's all that I miss though
customer_reviews.author: Majed Al Thobiti

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Heart rate is accurate, compared with other heart rate monitors. Very easy to use. I like that it is basic. The chest band is very comfortable and I usually forget I am wearing it. My only negative comments would be that when I use gloves to work out the buttons sometimes get pressed. Also I think the watch would be perfect if it had an elastic band like the one on the sensor. When lifting weights I find my self constantly loosening the watch as my arms get a pump. While doing cardio and non arm workouts this is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: I. Nijjar

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to use and especially nice is that it works ...
customer_reviews.text: This works outstandingly and is extremely accurate, I've checked it against a hospital monitor. The strap is no issue at all and you don't notice it when you're working out. It's easy to use and especially nice is that it works both as an everyday watch and then as a heart monitor when working out. The buttons are very easy to learn, one quick read of their functions and I haven't needed to check the guide since. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: CDB

customer_reviews.title: The right info for you.
customer_reviews.text: This Heart rate monitor give me the right info about my work out; usually those days I am tired or stressed out for work. IF I feel a lot of energy I will do intervals of my maximum heart rate (170 beats per minute at 90%) and (157 beats per minute at 85%) or if I feel tired I will do all my entire work put at (157 beats per minute at 85 %). It also help you to do an exact time of work out and understand how many calories you have burnt.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Obediente

customer_reviews.title: ... would be too large but it fits me just fine and I'm pretty small
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat worried that being a Men's monitor it would be too large but it fits me just fine and I'm pretty small. I chose this one because I needed to more accurately track calories burned. I would have rated it a 5 except that it's very workout focused. There is no independent stop-watch or timer function and you cannot get a heart rate reading unless you start a new session. So depending on what I want to use it for, sometimes I still have to use the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, effective, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This product is incredibly easy to set up - and once you figure out which button does what (about three minutes of trial and error)- easy to use. While not available in as many cute colors as the FT4, I love that this model allows you to keep track of previous workouts. Both the watch and the chest strap are comfortable and have a wide range of size adjustments. I was suspicious that a chest strap could be comfortable, but it feels about the same as the band on a sports bra and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: my second one...the only one think I do not like about the POLAR watches is the watch battery compartment...
customer_reviews.text: my second one...the only one think I do not like about the POLAR watches is the watch battery compartment....you better get a GOOD grip and a THICK object that fits the indentation in the back of the PERFECTLY ...if not...once you "strip" it .....you are done...never to be open again...send it to Polar for repairs? ...cost you the same as buying a new watch (-$15.00). PUT A METAL BACKING IF YOU ARE GOING TO DO THIS POLAR !!!! I have one other watch sitting in the drawer... screwed up.... unable to open.....
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Viademonte

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY AWESOME!!
customer_reviews.text: I am completely wholeheartedly in love with this HRM! The controls are super easy to use, the manual is straight forward, the washing process is the only annoying thing but it's understandable. Be sure to read the washing instructions thoroughly on the website given in the manual! I would recommend this product to the serious athlete as well as a beginner. I am a beginner and this keeps me motivated and shows me exactly how much work I am doing and putting into my workouts! I am a woman and bought the men's one because I wanted it in black, on Polar's website they do not differentiate between M and F so I figured it was okay!
customer_reviews.author: vampy31

customer_reviews.title: Accurate HR monitor, with helpful features
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is accurate, and has several nice features that allow me to monitor/record/track my workouts. The Amazon price was very good. It comes with a "quick-start" guide. If you want more detailed instructions, you'll need to download them in PDF from Polar's website. My only "complaint", and I knew that when I bought it, is that the display is too small for my middle aged eyes. It's a large "watch", so would be nice if the screen could take up more of that space.
customer_reviews.author: D. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: 1 year and 11 months after I bought this the transmitter died. I called tech support and they gave me some things to try but none worked. They gave me a RMA to send it back to get it fixed, no charge. I sent it in and they fixed it, and within a week I had it back working great! Great customer service, Great warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Karen D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but left handers may experience small problem.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate heart rate monitor that fits comfortably thanks to the strap with tons of holes. The strap allows for wrists of all sizes to wear it. However, thanks to the positioning of the "Stop" button, I've had issues as a left hander of accidentally stopping or pausing my session, especially while lifting weights. While its not difficult to get it started again, there have been several times where I haven't noticed for quite some time and my readings will then be inaccurate. All in all this is a good device, I just with the "stop" button either was moved or wasn't so sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Impressed so far!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had it for a long time, but the few days I have used it in the gym, I am impressed with so far. It was fast to detect my heart rate, and it never lost connection through my 30 minutes of cardio. At the end of your workout it gives you a nice little summary of calories burned, average & max heart rate, along with length of workout. Definitely worth the investment and Amazon shipping is always top notch!
customer_reviews.author: *sc*

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even make it a year
customer_reviews.text: After just shy of a year, I'm going to have to replace this heart rate monitor. It won't continue to monitor my heart rate through an entire workout anymore, just goes to "00" and suggests I check the heart rate transmitter. This has happened occasionally the entire time I've had it, but has happened every time I've used it for the past week (6 workouts, 6 failures) Sad that it didn't even make a year...
customer_reviews.author: MLineberry

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help keep track of the calories that I burn I was using Noom on my phone. Amazingly the calorie burn recorded on Noom is close to the monitor. It was easy to setup and operate. There are a couple of things that I don't like 1. They should have different sizes of the heart rate monitor the band is tight on me and I can't imagine a larger person wearing it. The buttons on the band dig into the back of my hand when I do push ups other than that so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Kenton

customer_reviews.title: Love this heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: Love this heart rate monitor. I have had it for a full month now and use it 2 times a day. It is put through its paces in and of the water and have had no issues. A great feature not advertised is it connects to cardio​ machines treadmills ellipticals or a stair master on its own and dont have to keep using the heart rate monitor on the machines interrupting the flow of your workout.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Very useful device to track HR while working out.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Easy to see while working out. The data recording feature is very handy. The sounds it makes if you hit the HR limits are too low to be really useful.
customer_reviews.author: PD in NJ

customer_reviews.title: defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Bought this heart rate monitor about a 19 months ago but didn't use it. Finally I started to jog, so decided to pull this out of the package. Put it on followed all the instruction. Cant read my heart rate...I have washed the strap with soap like suggested, made sure it was damp, I even changed the batteries. Still getting "check heart rate transmitter" code. Really frustrated so far. Spent $15 on batteries to try and solve a problem with a brand new product. Will try and work with Amazon to get this resolved and only then will this low rating change. Am still under the 2 year warranty so I will have an update for you soon.
customer_reviews.author: Devon noble

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to ...but
customer_reviews.text: Nothing wrong with this equipment...it does what it's supposed to but I'm not sure it was my optimum choice. All the functions perform as advertised, but I have two minor complaints: The heart rate readout on the monitor is really small...see the photo. My old eyes ain't the best and I use this primarily on my bike which entails an uncomfortable amount of distraction if I try to check the monitor while really cranking on. Secondly, (and this is just an annoyance) they have cheapened the attaching mechanism on the strap. It still works but it is cheesy and clumsy to use.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Mawdsley

customer_reviews.title: Didn't live up to expectations.
customer_reviews.text: It may be my chest/body but I had a hard time getting this Polar to register my heart rate. If I didn't move and was stationary then it would (sometimes) get my heart rate. But once I started working out I would lose my hr. I moistened the sensor etc. I returned mine and got a Timex HRM. This model was recommended by my workout coach so your mileage may vary. In fact he has an earlier version and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: bopfan

customer_reviews.title: Works for casual cyclist or runner
customer_reviews.text: It is okay not great I have gone through several of these types of product. I cycle and looking for a heart monitor for that. It is doing the job but not easy to navigate while you are in action. However, does track the heart rate with no issues. If you are a casual rider of runner then this is the product for you. If you are looking for something high end or you put in a lot of miles a week, invest in something with more options.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Looks like I got a defective one. Right out of the box it had trouble detecting my heart rate. I tried it for a few weeks, used electrode gel, shaved my chest, and tried putting chest monitor in slightly different location on my chest in hopes of getting a heartbeat. Monitor had one of three issues; 1) no heartbeat detected, 2) would detect a heartbeat for a few minutes then lose signal, 3) heartbeat detection was all over the place 0hbs to 199hbs in a matter of seconds. Sent it back to Polar for warranty repair. Hopefully I will get a working one.
customer_reviews.author: labman

customer_reviews.title: Training for a set duration gets boring, and I slack off sometimes
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my heart rate monitor for a few weeks now. It serves two purposes: The first is that it displays my heart rate and caloric burn. The second is that it motivates me to work harder. If I go on a bike ride or to the gym, I push myself a little bit harder to hit the caloric threshold that I want to. If I want to burn 1000 calories that session, I make sure I hit my mark before I quit. Training for a set duration gets boring, and I slack off sometimes, but this really keeps me focused.
customer_reviews.author: btomblin386

customer_reviews.title: Right price for a capable heart rate monitor
customer_reviews.text: I selected the Polar FT7 HR monitor after reading several of the other reviews. It provides exactly what I needed for a workout besides the obvious HR counter; time in the zone and outside the zone (which you can set to your preference), total calories expended, night display, and ability to save your previous workout data. The only ding I would give it is that the strap is already starting to loose its shape (after about a full month's use).
customer_reviews.author: Anomalous009

customer_reviews.title: Polar FT7
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well for the most part. Occasionally have difficulty making connection with the strap, but resolves fairly easily and quickly. Goes through batteries faster than I expected. Strap broke after 3 years without any abnormal wear and tear. A new strap was more expensive than I could justify.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: I did have to reset it a couple of times because it got stuck reading some unrealistic number like 200 bpm when I was idle
customer_reviews.text: I train 6 days a week. Knowing how many calories you burn is important. I wear this every day at the gym. It gives me consistent reading 95% of the time. I did have to reset it a couple of times because it got stuck reading some unrealistic number like 200 bpm when I was idle. the watch is comfortable and so is the band that goes around your torso. This is my second FT7. Both from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Gonzalo Torres

customer_reviews.title: This works great. If you have a bit more cash to ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great. If you have a bit more cash to spend. Get the one that has Bluetooth connectability. I use both in the pool, the bike, and running.
customer_reviews.author: walter g

customer_reviews.title: The Polar FT7s are easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had one before. It worked well, but it just wore out. I used it almost everyday. The Polar FT7s are easy to use, easy to see the face, and relatively hassle free. The big plus for me is that it is accurate and works under a variety of conditions (ie: running, walking, biking, lifting, etc). The downside is the battery in the sending unit has a short life. They are good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Polar FT7
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for several months and it has held up well. I try to use it every time I work out and couldn't be happier with the results. The watch part is fairly easy to navigate and setup. On top of that it is also fairly light as most times I don't notice it. The actual monitor that straps to your chest is okay. I'm 6'1 and 205 and have no issues with the sizing. The strap is noticeable but something you get used to. Overall, if you are looking for a heart rate monitor this is a great beginner set. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Toribio

customer_reviews.title: Love my Polar FT7
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch, I got one for me and one for my boyfriend. Not only is it great to see the fruits of my labor but it also motivates me to work harder - get that heart rate up and burn those calories! The only issue I had with this watch was after two months of not using it I had trouble getting the watch to pick up my heart rate for a while, but once I started using it regularly again it has been working fine since.
customer_reviews.author: ndc

customer_reviews.title: User unfriendly
customer_reviews.text: Had a prior Polar FT 1 hear rate monitor and decided to upgrade. What a mistake. The device is user unfriendly and difficult to set. Although it asks for the a day setting for the start of the week there is no way to set the actual day of the week. Save your money. This is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Hoover's dad

customer_reviews.title: Solid, battle tested product - good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This product definitely withstands heavy usage and can handle submersion in water along with regular exercise regiments. The only complaint I offer is that the face could be a little bigger to make it easier to see the information on the screen, for those with less that 20/20 vision. Other than that, this is a good, solid product that is a great value relative to the many alternatives out there.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: but
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this watch, but the strap and heart monitor that comes with it on the other hand, not so good. I had an allergic reaction to the material, which is by no means the companies fault as I didn't know what the material was called making my skin get rashes, BUT the heart rate monitor itself, even with the prescribed instructions ( you have to wet the strip that read the heart monitor) is very faulty in its readings sometimes but usually normalizes after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Nice reliable product
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to use and seems pretty accurate at estimating calories burned for time spent vs estimates found on internet for comparison. The chest band is comfortable, adjustable and can be swished in soapy water as needed. It quickly detects my heart rate so no delays when I am ready to move out ! I have qctuallt forgotten to remove the chest band till later in the day as I don't feel it so it is quite comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: DobeLady

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT. I WOULD RECOMMEND IT.
customer_reviews.text: I helped to jump start my Fiancee's weight loss journey with this watch and the heart rate monitor that comes with it. Great GREAT product and extremely accurate where most others have failed. I too have one and we use them every time we go to work out or even to take a stroll around the neighborhood. Very comfortable watch and the heart rate monitor is pretty comfortable to wear as well.
customer_reviews.author: Savage

customer_reviews.title: Good overall, reliable, trusty training companion.
customer_reviews.text: It works well and I don't feel the strap 99% of the time. I could wear it comfortably all day with no discomfort or rash. I could even wear it when swimming but it does slip when you jump into the pool and you have to pull it a bit tighter than usual. The only thing I question about is the calories count. I recorded a 2000+ calories burn and I think that was way too much compared with the hike that I was doing. I take it to hiking, biking, walking and swimming and even when playing basketball.
customer_reviews.author: AmazingConsumer213

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Polar Watch and it works so much better than my first. I originally purchased the FT4 for women and from day one it never worked right. It would lose my heart rate...not connect...etc etc. I returned and after a few mths I decided to try the polar line again because other people's were working great with not issues. I went with the man's watch this time and do happy I did.....been working greats since the first time I used. The best part....it has yet to lose my heart rate....HUGE advantage over the FT4. I highly recommend the FT7.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Does not maintain heart rate
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this since it "does" exactly what I needed, avg HR and max HR. Unfortunately I did about 15 jogs/runs, and it only completely worked from start to finish three times. The rest of the times I would lose HR midway through the run, very annoying. Some other times it would not even pickup a HR before starting the run. I've tried making it super tight, placing it towards the sides, and even electrode gel but same result. I even bought and used new batteries to see if that was the issue. Maybe it was defective but my first Polar experience was not a pleasant one.
customer_reviews.author: jK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Sport: Cycling, I have not used it with running or swimming. Pros: Easy to use. Manual is available in line. Accurate. Light. Battery replaceable by user. The strap is comfortable. Cons: THe hook on the strap appears flimsy, hopefully it will not break The heart rate display can not be changed from HR to %max during exercise. ( Not a real problem) Difficult to read in the day if the night mode is accidentally turned on. IT turns off only by returning to time view.
customer_reviews.author: naja naja

customer_reviews.title: I hope it is only a fluke.
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this, but I can't. This is my second Polar FT7 over the past few years. The first died after much use and abuse, so I thought I would buy another. The new one only lasted two weeks. The watch itself is fine. Easy to use and read, but the chest strap and monitor is another story, it stopped after 2 weeks of use. Tried new batteries, a new strap; no luck, it is dead. Thankfully amazon has a great return policy for prime members. I only hope the next one lasts as long as the first one I bought a few years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6 ft 200 lb fit. Works great. I love keeping track of my burns. It's a dot uncomfy but u get used to it no rashes or anything I was it in the sink. It's watch is 1980s sophist action wise buy if it ain't broke polar ain't gonna fix it. They just probably get knocked out of the market by the smartphone guys once they make a strap that connect to my phone then I don't need the dumb watch interface.
customer_reviews.author: You Know Me

customer_reviews.title: Very Dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: Polar has the best software but their hardware does not last. I have replace heart rate monitors and watches. I am done with them.
customer_reviews.author: DLM1219

customer_reviews.title: Great Heart Rate Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Love my FT7. It's comfortable, the chest strap is comfortable, for the most part (unless worn too long), and it's easy to use! It has just the right amount of functions for your average level of fitness. I love that it keeps track of my workouts (up to a certain amount), however, I wish you didn't have to buy a completely separate device to use the sync function and track my information online. If my phone can pair with my computer, why couldn't this device be made to transfer information easier, WITHOUT having to purchase another Polar device? It could... that was just Polar's way of making more $. Still though, I love this watch.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Great Heart Monitor! - Updated
customer_reviews.text: Great heart monitor! My only complaint is I wish it would tell you when the hart monitor battery was low or dead. Now I have bought 3 of these FT7's. I am very hard on them and they will eventually fail but overall I am very happy with the performance of the Heart Rate Monitor. Each one I have bought has some improvements to the previous one. I will continue to buy Polar products.
customer_reviews.author: R. Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: so far I love this. I am a bigger girl and the ...
customer_reviews.text: so far I love this. I am a bigger girl and the heart rate monitor strap fits comfortably. I thought I might have issues with it slipping under my chest but it stays put through all my workouts. i like being able to track my calories burned and how much of it was fat burn vs fitness. if you are on the fence between this and the lower model. spend the extra 10-15 bucks and get this one. its worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I've seen mixed reviews about the FT7 but I haven't had any issues with it. The quality of the watch/band itself would be better if it were silicone and not such a stiff plastic, but its only used for workouts so its alright for its purpose. The only thing I wonder is if the workouts and calories burned are accurate and if so, "HOW" accurate it is. I know I workout hard doing weights for 45mins to 1 hour, followed by 30-45 mins of cardio, and the calories burned are usually between 1300 - 1700. I still haven't figured out if the watch can tell me the amount of fat calories from the total calories burned.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: You would have to have hearing that could hear a pin drop to hear sounds from the watch monitor. There isn't any volume adjustment at all for the alarm sounds. I set the alarm for my max heart rate, and looked down and I was 15 beats above it without hearing so much as a peep. When I returned, I set the regular alarm to go off at a certain time. When it did the watch face flashed (a lot of good that does if you're sleeping), and the only way either my wife or I could hear the alarm was to hold the watch next to our ears.
customer_reviews.author: rockinblu

customer_reviews.title: Everything I need, no more, no less
customer_reviews.text: You could over complicate things with too many bells and whistles. Not the FT7. It has everything necessary. I am NOT a runner, which most people think the FT7 is for. The users are a much broader market, and it should be. I'm older, and work out twice a week, walk regularly, and enjoy measuring various activity levels. Sometimes I even monitor my full nights sleep. The FT7 is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: David in SAC

customer_reviews.title: Good polar product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my older brother. I have the old polar F55 and was very satisfied with it's functionality. This one was very light weight compared to my clunky F55. It's nice that it has user replaceable battery unlike my old one which has to have the battery replaced at a jewelry/watch store. According to my brother the soft strap is comfortable and reliable and easy to navigate the menus on the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Libra87

customer_reviews.title: Great HRM for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my first heart rate monitor, and I'm really happy with it after 1 week of use (5 workouts). It has impressed me so far with ease of use. I expected a complicated menu system and poorly-written instructions. In reality, the instructions and menu system are very clear. The sensor chest strap is also very comfortable. The only thing I don't like is the inability to customize what's on the display during a workout. You can select from a few screens, but can't pick-and-choose the two pieces of information you want at once. It's really a minor annoyance, though.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Stanwood

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My first heart monitor ever. It's better than I expected. No crazy functionality, no complexity. It's super simple and direct to operate so you never get confuse. It comes with only the functionality that I need. The strap band is also good, easy to adjust and comfortable. The transmitter, that goes on the strap, is bit big and cluncky. Another bonus thing is that many fitness products, like threadmills, are compatible with the transmitter so you can see some info in the machine's display automatically. And I still wear the watch all the time because the design is cool enought. A great product for the value.
customer_reviews.author: William R. J. Ribeiro

customer_reviews.title: poor to non-existent quality control
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this during the holidays. Wore it during indoor training. It communicated with my Lemond spinner, which was nice. The transmitter just stopped working in March. I returned it (at my expense, of course). It was repaired and returned to me. Last weekend, it stopped transmitting again. This is unacceptable. It will insist on a refund, and wait for this type of device to evolve a bit, before getting back in to it.
customer_reviews.author: thebowl

customer_reviews.title: Is as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: The FT7 watch functions fine, but to me the Polar watches get bigger and uglier with each generation as I looked at my drawer of three Polar watches from the past few years. The audible alert is not loud enough for me. The strap works fine, but is about 3 inches shorter than my old Polar strap and does not stretch to XXL to me.
customer_reviews.author: Helpful7

customer_reviews.title: Great little heart monitor
customer_reviews.text: I had a heart attack last year and really just wanted a good accurate heart monitor to keep an eye on my heart rate while exercising. I don't use all the features this has available, but it seems to give a very consistent reading and works great. The transmitter is also automatically read by the machines at my gym so I'm not having to look at my wrist all the time. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Kendrick

customer_reviews.title: and that's only if you are large busted like me. My sports bra bands are pretty thick ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second polar heart rate monitor. I would say the only downfall for these is the chest strap, and that's only if you are large busted like me. My sports bra bands are pretty thick and can rub with the heart rate band. But I've tried some of the wrist heart rate monitors and I find they aren't as accurate as these.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.K

customer_reviews.title: Not at all the quality Polar once had.
customer_reviews.text: Man has the quality of Polar gone down hill. I now wished that I had my older original Polar fixed instead of buying a new one. The watch looks and feels like a kids costume fake watch. The quality is that poor. It feels like a disposable watch it's that cheaply made. I give it a 3 star rating as it still does the job, just very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M.

product_meta.title: Power Systems Polar FT7 Heart Rate Monitor, Exercise Training Watch, Black/Silver (92018)
product_meta.description:
Polar FT7 heart rate monitor watch offers all the features of the FT4 plus Energy Pointer. Energy Pointer visually indicates when you are in your fat-burning range or aerobic fitness range. A weekly training summary provides feedback for your workouts and keeps up to 99 files in memory. Coded to avoid frequency interruptions. Provides automatic target zone to help maintain the intensity, but can be changed by the user. Audible alarm alerts the user when out of their zone. Counts and displays caloric expenditure. Tracks totals for session, training hours, and in-zone training. Button-free Heart Touch function. Since 1986, Power Systems' passion for fitness has been fueled by our customers. Power Systems is committed to ensuring people have the tools to lead active lives with professional-grade products, cutting-edge educational materials, and elite customer service. “Power Your Potential" is the philosophy that guides everything Power Systems stands for.

AMAZON.COM
The Polar FT7 is a rugged watch and data-tracking heart rate monitor, combined in one attractive package. An innovative EnergyPointer feature graphically displays real-time information during your workout, letting you know if you're burning fat or improving aerobic fitness. The FT7 comes complete with comfortable fabric transmitter and coded heart rate transmission, to avoid electronic cross-talk. 



An easy-to-read EnergyPointer feature tells you if you're burning fat (left of center line) or building fitness (right of center line).  What's in the box?


 * Polar FT7 training computer 
 * Polar WearLink+ transmitter 
 * FT7 Getting Started Guide 

 Smart Coaching Features


 * Energy Pointer: If you want to improve your fitness or burn fat, EnergyPointer is an easy-to-use feature that visually shows the main effect of your training, so you can focus on what you want to achieve. 
 * OwnCal: OwnCal is one of the most accurate calorie counters on the market. It calculates the number of calories expended during a training session based on your weight, height, age, gender, individual maximum heart rate (HRmax), and how hard you’re training. 
 * Training Load: The web-based Training Load helps you strike a balance between rest and training, showing your daily cumulative training load, and advising when rest days are needed and when it’s best to train harder in order to maintai performance improvement. 

 Features


 * Body Measurement
    * Average and maximum heart rate of training 
    * Heart rate as BPM or percentage of max 
    * HRmax (user-set) 
    * Manual target zone as BPM 
   
   
 * Data transfer
    * Compatible with Intel-based Mac, PC, and polarpersonaltrainer.com 
   
   
 * Web-based functionality
    * Training analyzing 
    * Training diary 
    * Training load 
    * Training programs 
   
   
 * Recording
    * Totals 
    * 99 training files with summaries 
    * Weekly history 
   
   
 * Training
    * Graphical target zone indicator 
    * HeartTouch button-free operation of wrist unit 
   
   
 * Watch
    * Backlight 
    * Date and weekday indicator 
    * Displays text in English, German, Finnish, Swedish, French, Portuguese, Spanish, and Italian 
    * Dual time zone 
    * KeyLock 
    * Low battery indicator 
    * Time of day (12/24h) with alarm and snooze 
    * User-replaceable battery 
    * Water resistant to 30 meters 
   
   

 Warranty
Polar timing products include a limited two-year manufacturer's warranty against defects in materials and workmanship. 

 About Polar
Established in 1977, Polar products help you understand and maximize your training. The company's combination of expertise in sports, physiology, and electronics results in an innovative product line of fitness tools for athletes of all ability levels to achieve desired results.
feature_bullets: Adjustable, audible alarm alerts the user when out of their zone
Tracks totals for session, training hours, in-zone training and provides weekly training summary
Fitness training watch for walking, running, biking, circuit, HIIT and other cardio workouts
